Uncertainties surrounding peace plan put Ukraine in a complicated spot
subhead: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said progress has been made in talks between the American and Ukrainian teams in Florida on Sunday. Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff, criticized for his close ties to Russia, is expected to present an amended draft of a peace plan to Russian leader Vladimir Putin on Monday.

Netanyahu seeks pardon from Israel's president and prepares for re-election campaign
In Lebanon and Turkey, Leo XIV stands out for his measured diplomacy
subhead: After spending three days in Turkey, the pope arrived in Lebanon on Sunday for the second leg of his first trip abroad since his election. As in Istanbul, he chose his words with care, exercising restraint to avoid any missteps in a country shaped by religious tensions.

title: Two births and 27 deaths in one village: Poland's tumbling birthrate
subhead: With an average of 1.03 children per woman, Poland has the lowest fertility rate in Europe. Increasing family allowances has not changed that. The exhaustion of the population following the collapse of the 1990s, and then two decades of economic boom, is one of the explanations.

title: Long-lost Rubens 'masterpiece' sells for almost €3 million
subhead: The work of Jesus Christ on the cross, painted in 1613, was unearthed by auctioneer Jean-Pierre Osenat in a Paris mansion last year.

title: Louvre's former Pavillon des Sessions reopens amid turmoil
subhead: Renamed the Gallery of the Five Continents, the space will reopen to the public on December 3, even as the Louvre faces accusations of prioritizing high-profile renovations over security.

Can French citizens be mobilized in the event of war?
subhead: Statements by General Fabien Mandon and President Emmanuel Macron's announcements about a voluntary national service have raised questions about a scenario that, until recently, seemed unimaginable.

title: 'Dédé la Sardine' and Russian oil: Inside the affair that has haunted Total for 15 years
subhead: Seven people have been ordered to stand trial for their involvement in an arbitration process that was allegedly manipulated in order to extract the equivalent of €16 billion from French oil company Total. Their trial begins on Monday.

title: The art of being Oscar Wilde's grandson
subhead: As Ireland prepares to mark the 125th anniversary of Oscar Wilde's death, Merlin Holland, his only living descendant, works in France to protect the memory of a man who was long viewed as scandalous.
